item.title: Reading list
item.description: This is a curated list of reading material and code projects that I enjoy and recommend to others: Coding philosophy Twelve-factor app Architecture Patterns with Python by Harry Percival, Bob Gregory Test-Driven Web Development with Python by Harry Percival Python: Functional programming HOWTO by A. M. Kuchling Awesome scalability An updated and organized reading list for illustrating the patterns of scalable, reliable, and performant large-scale systems. The C4 model for visualising software architecture - Context, Containers, Components, and Code General tech Stop Emailing Like A Rube - Jeffery Paul Security Cybersecurity readings Projects General Advent of Code Web HUGO - The worldâ€™s fastest framework for building websites Streamlit - A faster way to build and share data apps Machine learning Explainable AI with Shap - Scott Lundberg Forecasting at scale with Facebook Prophet Featuretools Featuretools is a python library for automated feature engineering.

item.title: About
item.description: This is me ðŸ‘‹ Hi, Iâ€™m Morten DÃ¦hli Aslesen, and I’m currently working as an IT-consultant at Bouvet Norway ASA where I’ve been since 2020. My background is in Economics and Nanotechnology, but in my professional career I have been focusing on advanced analytics, machine learning, data platforms and software development. I’m an avid DevOps practitioner, I prefer simple elegant and pragmatic solutions, clean explicit code and trunk based development.
